messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1555
messages.msgSnippet: I d just like to say, BRAVO Deborah! I couldn t have said it better myself! Meghan ... kids too. Don t tell ... either. ... hurt you or our ...
messages.messageBody:
I'd just like to say, BRAVO Deborah! I couldn't have
said it better myself!
Meghan

>Start a new thread. Don't read what annoys you.
>Start talking about
>what
>you're interested in, get other folks interested with
>you.

>This is the essence of unschooling, for adults >and
kids too. Don't tell
>people they shouldn't be interested in something
>because you aren't,
>don't
>expect them to do and say exactly what you are
>interested in doing and
>saying. If you want to learn about something, do it.
>If you want to
>show
>people something wonderful, do it. If you want to
>stop listening and go
>read
>a book, do it. Don't drag your kids off from what
>they're interested in
>to do
>what you think is important, and don't shush >adults
either.

>It IS a free country. The framers of our constitution
>established free
>speech
>as a right PRECISELY for situations like this, so
>that no one need ever
>fear
>criticizing their government, it's actions, or it's
>policies. If it
>truly is
>the greatest nation on earth that is a huge reason
>why.

>I'm interested in hearing everything folks have to
>say on all sides of
>this,
>except I'd like to ask the shushers to please, go
>ahead and talk about
>something else but allow the rest of these folks to
>talk in peace here
>without trying to shut them up. Their opinions >can't
hurt you or our
>country.
>Thanks.

>Deborah

__________________________________________________

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1555
messages.msgSnippet: I also live in a small town (in very Northern CA). The local paper had an article about halloween and there were quite a few comments from parents who said
messages.messageBody:
I also live in a small town (in very Northern CA). The
local paper had an article about halloween and there
were quite a few comments from parents who said they
were not going to let their kids trick or treat
because they're afraid they might get anthrax
poisoning! I mean REALLY! Who is going to come up here
in the back of beyond and poison a bunch of little
kids? The fear and paranoia is getting just a tad
(sarcasm) out of hand in my opinion.
Meghan

>Went to the Social Security office today. Now, we
>live in the boonies.
>I seriously doubt that anyone could find us on the
>map let alone would
>think
>about making a "statement" here.

>Life has become weird!

>Lynda
